ssc
Class SenseSmartCity

java.lang.Object
  ssc.SenseSmartCity

public class SenseSmartCity
extends java.lang.Object

This library is the client side of Sense Smart City. SSC is a restful server providing snow information such as weight, humidity, depth and temperature for a given location. The aim is to protect people and property. SSC is developed and maintained by the Swedish city of Skellefte√•.

This library is the result of a student project in the course D0016E digital projekt lp 3 2013. The target system is Android but this library is tested on standard JDK 6 without problem. Some minor changes was needed in RestfulClient to make it work on Android.

Snow information is collected using sensors. There is different kinds of sensors depending on type of measurement. Here only snow pressure is implemented. Measurement is done periodly and each reading is taged with time, date and the id of the sensor. So for each sensor there is a set of readings. Sensors belongs to a specific domain. In order to collect data from SSC user credentials is needed. A sensor can be visible to all users or private for users in the domain of that particular sensor. A sensor have location.

Note that the sensor itself and snow data collected by the same sensor is two different entities.

Much functionality is missing but it should not be any problem to continue the development. At least that was the idea behind the code structure.

Author:
Jim Gunnarsson, di98jgu

Parameters:

requestAll

public java.util.Map<Sensor,java.util.List<SnowPressure>> requestAll()
Request all data available for this user. Predefined values is used for fields and time period is to collect data. Default is last year and all fields.

Returns:
Map with Sensor as keys and values as a list of readings

requestSensorList

public java.util.List<Sensor> requestSensorList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sensors,
                                                boolean all)
Request list of sensors. A list of sensor id, serials, can be provided. A empty list equals all sensors. All sensors regardless of domain sensors is requested by setting all to true.

Parameters:
sensors - List of sensor id, empty for all sensors
all - True for all public sensors, false for private sensors only
Returns:
List with sensors.

requestSnowPressure

public java.util.Map<Sensor,java.util.List<SnowPressure>> requestSnowPressure(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> querys,
                                                                              java.lang.String period)
Request snow pressure readings. This is a compromise greatly simplify the design of this library but of course limit readings to snow pressure only. Should of course be able to handle all type of sensors. Need a list of sensors, at least one. None throws an exception. Desired fields is given as a list of queries, this can be empty but only a limit number of fields is then returned. A time period might be given, none is needed. All valid periods is found in SSCResources.

Parameters:
sensors - List of sensors
querys - List of fields
period - Time period
Returns:
A map with sensor as keys and list of readings as value

getSensorType

private java.util.List<Sensor> getSensorType(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                             java.lang.String type)
Get sensors of a given type. A filter simply, returning a list of Sensors of a desired type.

Parameters:
sensors - List of sensors
type - Type of sensor desired
Returns:
A sublist of sensors of desired type or empty if none is found

getSensorSerials

private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSensorSerials(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors)
Get a list of sensor serials. Serials is the unique id for each sensor.

Parameters:
sensors - List of sensors
Returns:
List of serials

responseArray

private org.json.JSONArray responseArray(java.lang.String data)
Take a response object and return response array. The response object is the raw JSON data retrieved from SSC server. It contain a key and a value. Here the value is assumed to be an array.

Parameters:
data - Raw JSON object from SSC server
Returns:
A JSON array containing the requested data
Throws:
SSCException.MalformedData - if data is not extractable

responseObject

private org.json.JSONObject responseObject(java.lang.String data)
Take a response object and return response object. The response object is the raw JSON data retrieved from SSC server. It contain a key and a value. Here the value is assumed to be a object.

Parameters:
data - Raw JSON object from SSC server
Returns:
A JSON object containing the requested data
Throws:
SSCException.MalformedData - if data is not extractable

Returns:
A map with Sensors as keys and list of readings as values
Throws:

defaultFields

private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> defaultFields()
Set values for default fields. If no fields is given at a request to SSC server this is the values to to use. Each sensor type have set of valid fields. A map is created there keys is the type of sensor and value is a list of all valid fields for that type.

Returns:
A map with type of sensor as key and a list of fields as value
